title: HMCTS Employment Tribunals - ET3 Form
description: ET3 is the form an employer files in response to a claimant's ET1. The service had previously been digitised in PHP. Using the existing service I rewrote the service in RoR.

title: In-house Logistics Platform
description: This is a closed-source project. This application was an in-house, custom-built logistics platform for a business with tens of millions of pounds in revenue.

title: Planned General Inspection Backend (Rail Industry)
description: UK rail staff must regularly inspect stations to ensure high standards. The Planned General Inspection app digitises this process via a mobile app. It interfaces with third party maintenance systems.

title: Personal Development Blog
description: This presented an opportunity to work with a project other than Ruby on Rails. Built using Gatsby (which is an SSG for react) and deployed on Netflix, this builds a static blog site from markdown entries.

title: Personal Portfolio
description: This website is coded from scratch as an opportunity to practice using Vue.js and Nuxt.js. It uses a projects.json file to load in content to the Projects page.

title: SQR (Rail Industry)
description: This app provides a dashboard for station and fleet managers to view and control defects raised by mystery shoppers. The system contains a number of external interfaces to supplier maintenance systems.

title: Ruby and Rails Upgrades (Various)
description: Upgrading relies on a test suite to highlight regressions, therefore most upgrades are primarily test-writing projects. Projects that have neglected to upgrade tend to have also neglected testing.

title: Internal Time Tracking Tool
description: Primarily in a mentoring capacity, oversaw development of an internal tool and enabled a junior developer to grow into their first role in the team.

title: Middleware API
description: A small Sinatra project to connect a client-side rendered frontend to a third party API. This app was necessary to protect API keys from prying eyes.
